title: WTF is Pyke's downside?
body:
Seriously....like wtf? I can't figure this bull shit champ out. What is his weakness? Back in the day EVERY champ had SOMETHING that gave them a downside / weakness. What the fuck is Pykes? How do you punish people who play this overloaded abomination?

Btw, I'm a mid laner but any tips to help out my bot lane would be great. (Don't say roam cause that's not reliable nor is it always an option, especially once Pyke spams R and kills bot over and over.)

replies.body:
You can ban him in champ select. That's my solution for him, works 100% of the time 

I think the champion was a mistake, so... Riot gave me the power to remove him from my games, I exercise that power

Enough bans lead to nerfs, do your part today

> [{quoted}](name=BigBrainSuppMain,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fWobvOc2,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-30T01:54:41.222+0000)
>
> You can ban him in champ select. That's my solution for him, works 100% of the time 
> 
> I think the champion was a mistake, so... Riot gave me the power to remove him from my games, I exercise that power
> 
> Enough bans lead to nerfs, do your part today

[laughs in >50% yasuo banrate for months]

> [{quoted}](name=BigBrainSuppMain,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fWobvOc2,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-30T01:54:41.222+0000)
>
> You can ban him in champ select. That's my solution for him, works 100% of the time 
> 
> I think the champion was a mistake, so... Riot gave me the power to remove him from my games, I exercise that power
> 
> Enough bans lead to nerfs, do your part today

Lol, yeah I usually do ban him but I'm tired of using my ban on that shit. I'm mid so I would like to ban {{champion:84}} or sometimes {{champion:103}} . Sucks cause if I ban one, the other is left open. Fucking coin flip. I wish my bot laners would perma ban Pyke so I could hit op mid laners.

You can dodge everything, he has a good early game but falls off and does nothing when behind, you can all in him pretty easily, doesn't do anything if his adc doesn't follow up.

Like there are a lot and basically thresh does everything he can do but better.

> [{quoted}](name=boricCentaur1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fWobvOc2,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-30T01:18:40.304+0000)
>
> You can dodge everything, he has a good early game but falls off and does nothing when behind, you can all in him pretty easily, doesn't do anything if his adc doesn't follow up.
> 
> Like there are a lot and basically thresh does everything he can do but better.

Cool so what button is Thresh's execute on?
And pyke is more then just a execute. Like if you actually think pyke is good because of a execute you probably have never seen a pyke.

I mean.. getting to literally ignore a large chunk of an enemy's health bar and sling lots of extra gold around is a pretty big damn deal. 

Executes are a shit mechanic, IMO.

It's not. If it was pyke would always be broken NEWSFLASH HE HAS NOT BEEN. 

Like all you are saying is you hate executes that has nothing to do with pyke, I hate invisibility but that doesn't mean I will say champions with it are broken because it since that is not how it works.

> [{quoted}](name=boricCentaur1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fWobvOc2,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-30T02:32:12.910+0000)
>
> And pyke is more then just a execute. Like if you actually think pyke is good because of a execute you probably have never seen a pyke.

Not saying that at all. But that is the thing I hate most about him. That fucking uninterruptible, reset-able, and way to strong execute. The rest of his kit pisses me off as well but that Ult is what really grinds my gears.
Objectively not true. Pyke is MUCH better at killing enemy champions than Thresh is.

Objective yes that is true wtf. Killing enemies is one part of support and a small part actually.

You never pick champions because they can get kills there are better champions then pyke for that.
Better for the support role? Because the only one I can think of who might be better is Zyra as she always does more damage over the course of a game than Pyke.

Are you trolling? Since again damage is a small part of the role like the majority of the pyke doesn't do a lot of damage it's his adc. 

Like again you don't pick champions because of damage in the the support role. Brand does more and so does sona actually.

Like this is not a counter point this is you ignoring facts.

LOL Pyke can solo an ADC with E ignite auto Q ult. One rotation of spells that he's guaranteed to hit all of if he lands his E stun

I know because I've done it. Champ is mobile, healing, invis, CC, execute, gives out lots of gold and has high base stats

Really just a stupid champion, overloaded to fuck. You can't punish him in lane. All he needs to do is collect coins and scale up, and coin is the most uninteractive item in the game

Pyke has free reliable scaling, he just needs to not int and he's a functioning Pyke every game

Ummm you can't do that. Like you know I can see the numbers right? Lying doesn't help you. It's actually impossible. 

Guy can you actually stop lying and give a argument?

You can easily punish him in lane if you can't you are SHOULD LOSE. 

Like again thresh is just better in almost every way.

Let's say he's level 13, trying to kill a level 14 Jinx 

He's maxed Q and E, 2 points in R and one in W

E deals 215+1*Bonus AD Physical damage

Ignite deals 310 True damage

Auto deals 1*Total AD

Q deals 275+.6*Bonus AD

R executes below 470+.8Bonus AD+1.5*Lethality

Aftershock deals 87.65+.04*Max HP

Sudden Impact gives 7 Lethality

Duskblade gives ~115 Physical damage on hit, 55AD and 21 lethality

Let's say Pyke has: {{item:3096}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3117}} 

He has: 1695hp, 83.9 Base AD + 67 Bonus AD and 18.67 armour pen + 6.22 from sudden impact

Lets say you're playing Jinx and she's level 14 

Jinx has 1596.6hp, 70.3 Armor, 36 MR
---

We only need to get Jinx into execute range before we hit R and we win, so what is execute Range? Well it's as above: 470+53.6+42=565.6hp. We have to reduce her hp by 1,031 to put her in execute range.

His E deals 215+67=282 physical damage

His Auto deals 150.9 physical damage

his Q deals 275+40.2=315.2 physical damage

Duskblade gives 115 physical damage

Total Physical damage: 863.1

Post mitigation damage: 593.6 Damage

---

Aftershock deals 155.45 magic damage

Post mitigation: 119.6 damage

---

Ignite 310 true damage

---

Total post mitigation: 1,023.2

Our target was: 1,031

---

It's entirely possible

The problem is that when he is behind all it takes is one lucky ult chain getting him a triple kill and guess what...he just bought a full item.  All that needs to be done to Pyke is revert the buff that gives him a cut as well as kill gold.
He is an ugly champ.

"What is his weakness?"

You mean aside from the fact that he can't build health? And aside from the fact that his overall damage is pretty shitty unless he's steamballing you? And aside from the fact that his basic abilities are straight lines?

Pyke actually falls off a cliff in late game..
He reaches full build in minute 25 and it's all downhill from there.

His waveclear is non-existant, his objective control is non-existant.
He can feed his team gold, but at some point you just outscale him.

Pyke cannot win the game alone.
No support can.
Not unless you got massive waveclear and strong tower pushing capabilities.
As many have stated, ban him. If you run into somebody that knows how to play him reasonably well, then you're going to lose the game 75% of the time. His kit is just overloaded so ban him.

Champs that shit on pyke from midlane: 

Yasuo
Heimerdinger
Diana
TF
Ahri (since the charm now interrupts dashes, Ahri is a fucking nightmare for pyke)
Cassiopea
Kassadin
Vladimir

1) No sustain for his allies.

2) He falls off.

3) He picks. He can't engage large fights well.

4) His core itemization is rather expensive for his role. If he doesn't get his snowball, he'll be behind.

5) His core itemization has no supportive properties. Someone buys Redemption and can heal thousands of hp across their team. He buys a Duskblade...as a support. Unless he's ahead, this isn't super fantastic.

That you can engage, kill, or poke out his ADC without too much effort. He's a kill lane, not too much in the realm of helping his partner survive beyond an E which is telegraphed and slow when you know exactly how he's going to use it once you attack the ADC. 

Pretend his ADC is Soraka, and Pyke himself is the tank/bruiser; same dynamic as a Soraka lane on how to win but different mentality of approach.
Healing and Spell Shields if possible
His weakness is his ult is easy to dodge. That's about all I can think of.
